page.title: 02GETTING TO SCHOOL.
page.content: There are seventeen children in this class,many of us come from farming families.Before we come to school some of us have jobs to do like helping with milking,feeding our ponies and other pets. Seven children live too far away to walk to school and have to come to school by car or truck.One girl comes by Land Rover because her farm track is too rough for a car. One day during the winter only six people could get through the snow and some of those had to leave early in case they could not get home. One girl helps her mother to make clotted cream which she sells.The Queen once had some of this. Other children's farms provide us with milk,potatoes,eggs and hay and straw to feed our animals.
